question: Question_03_(a)
sols:
The equation of a circle with radius 1 is
\emph{x}\textsuperscript{2}+\emph{y}\textsuperscript{2}=1 or, once we
solve for $y$, $y=\sqrt{1-x^2}$ (which gives the upper half of the
circle). Because we are rotating around the \emph{x}-axis, we will be
integrating between two points on the \emph{x}-axis. The left endpoint
is clearly \emph{0}. The right endpoint is a little trickier: it will be
the point where $y = x$ and $y = \sqrt{1 - x^2}$ intersect. This point
of intersection is found by setting these two curves equal and solving:

\begin{align*}
x &= \sqrt{1-x^2} \\ x^2 &= 1 - x^2  \\ x^2 &= \frac12 \\ x &= \pm\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\end{align*}.

Because we are in the first quadrant, the intersection point must be
positive. Thus we will be integrating between $\displaystyle 0$ and
$\frac1{\sqrt{2}}.$

If we use the Disc Method, the outside radius of the disc will be the
arc of the circle, given by $y = \sqrt{1-x^2}$ and the inside radius
will be given by the line $y = x$. Plugging these, and our endpoints,
into the integral, we get:

\begin{align*}
V &= \int_0^{\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}} \pi \left[\left(\sqrt{1-x^2}\right)^2 - \left(x\right)^2\right] dx \\
&= \int_0^{\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}} \pi \left[1-2x^2\right] dx  \\
&= \pi \left[ x-\frac{2x^3}{3}\right]_0^{\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}}  \\
&= \pi \left[ \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}-\frac{1}{3\sqrt{2}}\right] \\
&= \frac{\sqrt{2}}{3}\pi
\end{align*}
hints:
Because the expression is a function for x and is to be rotated about
the x-axis, we should use the disc method. When using the disc method,
we want to evaluate the integral

\[\pi \int_a^b [f(x)^2 - g(x)^2] dx\] where a and b are the smallest and
largest values of x in the region, f(x) is the largest y-value in the
region at x (which will be the outer radius of the disc) , and g(x) is
the smallest y-value in the region at x (which will be the inner radius
of the disc).

For this region, we have that $a = 0$. The rightmost x-value $b$ is the
point of intersection of the circle $x^2 + y^2 = 1$ and the line
$y = x$. Try to find the value of b and evaluate the integral.
